page.title: 17Customs-Geordie Day
page.content: { Geordie Day at Beamish { Geordie Day is an annual event celebrated at the Beamish Open Air Museum every July.The air is alive with the sound of a fairground organ,2000 pigeons,whippets,Punch and Judy and much more. One of the most popular events is the football match--1920's style,between ex-players from Newcastle United and Sunderland.The ex-players are now all in their sixties,but they intend to dress in the long shorts of the 1920's. Another colourful spectacle is North country wrestling,as the fighters dress in the traditional costume of long white pants which are heavily embroidered on the bottoms.
